name: Roo.form.MonthField
desc: Provides a date input field with a {@link Roo.DatePicker} dropdown and automatic date validation.

config.name: triggerClass
config.desc: An additional CSS class used to style the trigger button. The trigger will always get the class 'x-form-trigger' and triggerClass will be appended if specified (defaults to 'x-form-date-trigger' which displays a calendar icon).

config.name: useIso
config.desc:
if enabled, then the date field will use a hidden field to store the 
real value as iso formated date. default (true)

config.name: disableKeyFilter
config.desc: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false)

config.name: disabled
config.desc: True to disable the field (defaults to false).

config.name: validator
config.desc:
A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

config.name: disabledDates
config.desc:
An array of "dates" to disable, as strings. These strings will be used to build a dynamic regular expression so they are very powerful. Some examples:
  • ["03/08/2003", "09/16/2003"] would disable those exact dates
  • ["03/08", "09/16"] would disable those days for every year
  • ["^03/08"] would only match the beginning (useful if you are using short years)
  • ["03/../2006"] would disable every day in March 2006
  • ["^03"] would disable every day in every March
In order to support regular expressions, if you are using a date format that has "." in it, you will have to escape the dot when restricting dates. For example: ["03\\.08\\.03"].

config.name: name
config.desc: The field's HTML name attribute.

config.name: width
config.desc: width (optional) size of component

config.name: regexText
config.desc: The error text to display if {@link #regex} is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to "")

config.name: maxValue
config.desc:
The maximum allowed date. Can be either a Javascript date object or a string date in a
valid format (defaults to null).

config.name: altFormats
config.desc:
Multiple date formats separated by "|" to try when parsing a user input value and it doesn't match the defined
format (defaults to 'm/d/Y|m-d-y|m-d-Y|m/d|m-d|d').

config.name: minValue
config.desc:
The minimum allowed date. Can be either a Javascript date object or a string date in a
valid format (defaults to null).

config.name: allowDomMove
config.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

config.name: disabledDaysText
config.desc: The tooltip to display when the date falls on a disabled day (defaults to 'Disabled')

config.name: minText
config.desc:
The error text to display when the date in the cell is before minValue (defaults to
'The date in this field must be after {minValue}').

config.name: height
config.desc: height (optional) size of component

config.name: emptyText
config.desc: The default text to display in an empty field - placeholder... (defaults to null).

config.name: value
config.desc: A value to initialize this field with.

config.name: msgFx
config.desc: Experimental The effect used when displaying a validation message under the field (defaults to 'normal').

config.name: actionMode
config.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

config.name: disabledDatesText
config.desc: The tooltip text to display when the date falls on a disabled date (defaults to 'Disabled')

config.name: maxLengthText
config.desc: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to "The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}")

config.name: minLengthText
config.desc: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to "The minimum length for this field is {minLength}")

config.name: msgTarget
config.desc:
The location where error text should display. Should be one of the following values (defaults to 'qtip'): 
Value         Description
-----------   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
qtip          Display a quick tip when the user hovers over the field
title         Display a default browser title attribute popup
under         Add a block div beneath the field containing the error text
side          Add an error icon to the right of the field with a popup on hover
[element id]  Add the error text directly to the innerHTML of the specified element

config.name: listeners
readOnly
config.desc: True to mark the field as readOnly in HTML (defaults to false) -- Note: this only sets the element's readOnly DOM attribute.

config.name: focusClass
config.desc: The CSS class to use when the field receives focus (defaults to "x-form-focus")

config.name: disabledDays
config.desc: An array of days to disable, 0 based. For example, [0, 6] disables Sunday and Saturday (defaults to null).

config.name: hideTrigger
config.desc: True to hide the trigger element and display only the base text field (defaults to false)

config.name: cls
config.desc: A CSS class to apply to the field's underlying element.

config.name: validateOnBlur
config.desc: Whether the field should validate when it loses focus (defaults to true).

config.name: inputType
config.desc: The type attribute for input fields -- e.g. radio, text, password (defaults to "text").

config.name: fieldClass
config.desc: The default CSS class for the field (defaults to "x-form-field")

config.name: autoCreate
config.desc:
A DomHelper element spec, or true for a default element spec (defaults to
{tag: "input", type: "text", size: "10", autocomplete: "off"})

config.name: maskRe
config.desc: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null)

config.name: vtype
config.desc: A validation type name as defined in {@link Roo.form.VTypes} (defaults to null)

config.name: invalidClass
config.desc: The CSS class to use when marking a field invalid (defaults to "x-form-invalid")

config.name: validationEvent
config.desc:
The event that should initiate field validation. Set to false to disable
      automatic validation (defaults to "keyup").

config.name: fieldLabel
config.desc: Label to use when rendering a form.

config.name: blankText
config.desc: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to "This field is required")

config.name: selectOnFocus
config.desc: True to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus (defaults to false)

config.name: validationDelay
config.desc: The length of time in milliseconds after user input begins until validation is initiated (defaults to 250)

config.name: disableClass
config.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

config.name: tabIndex
config.desc: The tabIndex for this field. Note this only applies to fields that are rendered, not those which are built via applyTo (defaults to undefined).

config.name: format
config.desc:
The default date format string which can be overriden for localization support.  The format must be
valid according to {@link Date#parseDate} (defaults to 'm/d/y').

config.name: maxTextf
config.desc:
The error text to display when the date in the cell is after maxValue (defaults to
'The date in this field must be before {maxValue}').

config.name: regex
config.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

config.name: minLength
config.desc: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0)

config.name: allowBlank
config.desc: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true)

config.name: qtip
config.desc: Mouse over tip

config.name: maxLength
config.desc: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)

config.name: invalidText
config.desc:
The error text to display when the date in the field is invalid (defaults to
'{value} is not a valid date - it must be in the format {format}').

methods.name: getValue
methods.desc: Returns the current date value of the date field.

methods.name: setValue

params.name: date
params.desc: The date or valid date string

methods.name: onTriggerClick
methods.desc:
The function that should handle the trigger's click event.  This method does nothing by default until overridden
by an implementing function.

methods.name: selectText
methods.desc: Selects text in this field

params.name: start
params.desc: (optional) The index where the selection should start (defaults to 0)

params.name: end
params.desc: (optional) The index where the selection should end (defaults to the text length)

methods.name: validateValue
methods.desc:
Validates a value according to the field's validation rules and marks the field as invalid
if the validation fails

params.name: value
params.desc: The value to validate

methods.name: reset
methods.desc: Resets the current field value to the originally-loaded value and clears any validation messages.

methods.name: validate
methods.desc: Validates the field value

methods.name: getName
methods.desc: Returns the name attribute of the field if available

methods.name: markInvalid
methods.desc: Mark this field as invalid

params.name: msg
params.desc: The validation message

methods.name: getRawValue
methods.desc: Returns the raw data value which may or may not be a valid, defined value.  To return a normalized value see {@link #getValue}.

methods.name: applyTo
methods.desc: Apply the behaviors of this component to an existing element. This is used instead of render().

params.name: el
params.desc: The id of the node, a DOM node or an existing Element

methods.name: resetHasChanged
methods.desc: stores the current value in loadedValue

methods.name: isDirty
methods.desc:
Returns true if this field has been changed since it was originally loaded and is not disabled.
DEPRICATED  - it never worked well - use hasChanged/resetHasChanged.

methods.name: setRawValue
methods.desc: Sets the underlying DOM field's value directly, bypassing validation.  To set the value with validation see {@link #setValue}.

params.name: value
params.desc: The value to set

methods.name: clearInvalid
methods.desc: Clear any invalid styles/messages for this field

methods.name: isValid
methods.desc: Returns whether or not the field value is currently valid

params.name: preventMark
params.desc: True to disable marking the field invalid

methods.name: hasChanged
methods.desc:
checks the current value against the 'loaded' value.
Note - will return false if 'resetHasChanged' has not been called first.

methods.name: updateBox
methods.desc: Sets the current box measurements of the component's underlying element.

params.name: box
params.desc: An object in the format {x, y, width, height}

methods.name: setPagePosition
methods.desc:
Sets the page XY position of the component.  To set the left and top instead, use {@link #setPosition}.
This method fires the move event.

params.name: x
params.desc: The new x position

params.name: y
params.desc: The new y position

methods.name: syncSize
methods.desc: Force the component's size to recalculate based on the underlying element's current height and width.

methods.name: setSize
methods.desc:
Sets the width and height of the component.  This method fires the resize event.  This method can accept
either width and height as separate numeric arguments, or you can pass a size object like {width:10, height:20}.

params.name: width
params.desc: The new width to set, or a size object in the format {width, height}

params.name: height
params.desc: The new height to set (not required if a size object is passed as the first arg)

methods.name: getPosition
methods.desc: Gets the current XY position of the component's underlying element.

params.name: local
params.desc: (optional) If true the element's left and top are returned instead of page XY (defaults to false)

methods.name: onResize
methods.desc:
Called after the component is resized, this method is empty by default but can be implemented by any
subclass that needs to perform custom logic after a resize occurs.

params.name: adjWidth
params.desc: The box-adjusted width that was set

params.name: adjHeight
params.desc: The box-adjusted height that was set

params.name: rawWidth
params.desc: The width that was originally specified

params.name: rawHeight
params.desc: The height that was originally specified

methods.name: getBox
methods.desc: Gets the current box measurements of the component's underlying element.

params.name: local
params.desc: (optional) If true the element's left and top are returned instead of page XY (defaults to false)

methods.name: getSize
methods.desc: Gets the current size of the component's underlying element.

methods.name: onPosition
methods.desc:
Called after the component is moved, this method is empty by default but can be implemented by any
subclass that needs to perform custom logic after a move occurs.

params.name: x
params.desc: The new x position

params.name: y
params.desc: The new y position

methods.name: setPosition
methods.desc:
Sets the left and top of the component.  To set the page XY position instead, use {@link #setPagePosition}.
This method fires the move event.

params.name: left
params.desc: The new left

params.name: top
params.desc: The new top

methods.name: getId
methods.desc: Returns the id of this component.

methods.name: render
methods.desc: If this is a lazy rendering component, render it to its container element.

params.name: container
params.desc: (optional) The element this component should be rendered into. If it is being applied to existing markup, this should be left off.

methods.name: destroy
methods.desc:
Destroys this component by purging any event listeners, removing the component's element from the DOM,
removing the component from its {@link Roo.Container} (if applicable) and unregistering it from {@link Roo.ComponentMgr}.

methods.name: isVisible
methods.desc: Returns true if this component is visible.

methods.name: setDisabled
methods.desc: Convenience function for setting disabled/enabled by boolean.

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Hide this component.

methods.name: focus
methods.desc: Try to focus this component.

params.name: selectText
params.desc: True to also select the text in this component (if applicable)

methods.name: show
methods.desc: Show this component.

methods.name: enable
methods.desc: Enable this component.

methods.name: setVisible
methods.desc: Convenience function to hide or show this component by boolean.

params.name: visible
params.desc: True to show, false to hide

methods.name: disable
methods.desc: Disable this component.

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns the underlying {@link Roo.Element}.

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: on
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional)

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

params.name: object
params.desc: The object with the events defined

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to release

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

params.name: args
params.desc: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The name of the event to check for

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to capture

params.name: fn
params.desc: The function to call

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the fn

methods.name: addListener
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options

events.name: *select
events.desc: Fires when a date is selected

params.name: combo
params.desc: This combo box

params.name: date
params.desc: The date selected

events.name: *autosize
events.desc:
Fires when the autosize function is triggered.  The field may or may not have actually changed size
according to the default logic, but this event provides a hook for the developer to apply additional
logic at runtime to resize the field if needed.

params.name: this
params.desc: This text field

params.name: width
params.desc: The new field width

events.name: *blur
events.desc: Fires when this field loses input focus.

events.name: *valid
events.desc: Fires after the field has been validated with no errors.

events.name: *specialkey
events.desc:
Fires when any key related to navigation (arrows, tab, enter, esc, etc.) is pressed.  You can check
{@link Roo.EventObject#getKey} to determine which key was pressed.

params.name: e
params.desc: The event object

events.name: *focus
events.desc: Fires when this field receives input focus.

events.name: *keyup
events.desc: Fires after the key up

params.name: e
params.desc: The event Object

events.name: *invalid
events.desc: Fires after the field has been marked as invalid.

params.name: msg
params.desc: The validation message

events.name: *change
events.desc: Fires just before the field blurs if the field value has changed.

params.name: newValue
params.desc: The new value

params.name: oldValue
params.desc: The original value

events.name: *move
events.desc: Fires after the component is moved.

params.name: x
params.desc: The new x position

params.name: y
params.desc: The new y position

events.name: *resize
events.desc: Fires after the component is resized.

params.name: adjWidth
params.desc: The box-adjusted width that was set

params.name: adjHeight
params.desc: The box-adjusted height that was set

params.name: rawWidth
params.desc: The width that was originally specified

params.name: rawHeight
params.desc: The height that was originally specified

events.name: *beforerender
events.desc: Fires before the component is rendered. Return false to stop the render.

events.name: *disable
events.desc: Fires after the component is disabled.

events.name: *render
events.desc: Fires after the component is rendered.

events.name: *destroy
events.desc: Fires after the component is destroyed.

events.name: *hide
events.desc: Fires after the component is hidden.

events.name: *beforehide
events.desc: Fires before the component is hidden. Return false to stop the hide.

events.name: *show
events.desc: Fires after the component is shown.

events.name: *beforeshow
events.desc: Fires before the component is shown.  Return false to stop the show.

events.name: *enable
events.desc: Fires after the component is enabled.

events.name: *beforedestroy
events.desc: Fires before the component is destroyed. Return false to stop the destroy.
